Symptoms continued and she felt weak, so she went to the ED on . In the ED, guaiac positive, H/H stable and sent home. She continued to have diarrhea, had episodes of vomiting, and returned to the ED on with diarrhea, chest pain, dizziness. EKG without ischemic changes. Trop 0.05. CXR with hiatal hernia. Guaiac positive again, no gross blood. Discharged with Zofran. At home, she was confused about whether to take her normal medications. She has had poor PO intake, felt weak, and continued to have diarrhea. She called , and told her to go back to the ED for admission. At time of going to the ED, she had no chest pain. No f/c/s. No N/V but unable to tolerate PO. No urinary symptoms. Brief Hospital Course: w/ a-fib on apixaban, AVNRT w/aberrancy, type 2 MI in , HTN, HLD, chronic diarrhea, p/w several days of DOE, dizziness, decreased PO tolerance, abd pain, diarrhea; admitted for diarrhea and dehydration. #DIARRHEA The patient's diarrhea was on a resolving course at presentation and continued to improve without intervention. Stool studies collected two days prior had been negative for bacterial colitis. She endorsed sore throat, rhinorrhea and other URI symptoms, so a viral illness is suspected. She has a pre-existing follow-up appointment with her GI doctor, , in two days. #DEHYDRATION She was given IVF until euvolemic with resolution of her lightheadedness and subjective dyspnea. #ABDOMINAL PAIN Abdominal pain also resolved without intervention while she was observed in the hospital. Pain was worst in the URQ but she is s/p cholecystectomy and also had unremarkable LFTs. Troponins were trended and were weakly positive, but stayed level-to-downtrending. It is possible that she has PUD, given her history of NSAID use for OA; NSAIDs were held and Dr. is asked to re-evaluate at outpatient follow up. #MILDLY ELEVATED D-DIMER Patient had a d-dimer checked due to subjective dyspnea. While above limits of the assay (600), it is probably normal given her age and acute illness. After IVF she had no more subjective dyspnea; vital signs were not suggestive of a PE. Discharge Instructions: Dear Ms. , You were admitted to due to a diarrheal illness and inability to keep food and liquid down. You also reported difficulty breathing, dizziness, and shortness of breath. We did a workup of your lungs and heart which were normal. Your diarrheal episodes and oral intake improved throughout your hospital stay. It is important that you maintain adequate hydration and nourishment after discharge. Please make every effort to attend your follow-up appointments listed below. It was a pleasure taking care of you! We wish you the best! Your team Followup Instructions:
